title: _act_
author: _act_
content: I am a big fan of what to come for bitcoin which is bitcoin spot ETF. Some people have been predicting how bitcoin spot ETF would be one of the reasons for the big bull run coming next year and the follow year. But not only the reason. If it is announced by United States SEC that bitcoin spot ETF has been approved, that is only indicating bull run which would be significant. I want to know the exact second that SEC would approve bitcoin spot ETF directly. I do not want it to be what I will read on the crypto new later after people would have bought and the price would have increased. Although there is more to bitcoin spot ETF because more people will invest and bitcoin marketcap may not get below trillion of dollar ever again. How can I get the news directly from the SEC in a matter of a second? Is it through their website or which news?

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.created_time: July 13, 2023, 09:07:04 AMLast edit: July 13, 2023, 09:19:45 AM by EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Advice: Bitcoin would rise significantly within the next 2 years irrespective of the approval of spot ETF. Therefore, you might just buy your Bitcoin at any time and hold it unless you are referring to trading it in futures upon the spot ETF approval.Quote from: _act_ on July 13, 2023, 07:46:17 AMHow can I get the news directly from the SEC in a matter of a second? Is it through their website or which news?The first issue is that SEC through sec.gov doesn't provide such needed service, they can share updates on their website and on interviews. What you are requesting might be difficult to get as this would further rely on syncs to make it as fast as you desire into your device even when a news outlet wants to deliver it directly to you. Even if you get updates from reliable news sites, the news outlet would still add other write-ups which would further delay the pace that you want. Meaning that you should erase the mind that any news outlet could deliver the news in that same second, that is not possible. But if it's 'scheduled news,' I can assure you that https://www.cryptocraft.com can update the outcome on their website within a few seconds. They don't write stories like the regular news outlets, they just update the actual release.The only responsibility from you is to visit the site regularly when you know there is a likelihood of such spot ETF news. By then, they would have shared the news time or indicated it as tentative.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 13, 2023, 07:46:17 AMHow can I get the news directly from the SEC in a matter of a second? Is it through their website or which news?One is through their website and anything related to their socials. That's the quickest way to know if you've got no person and connection inside the agency. But if you've got a friend or someone you're connected with working with them, that's one way that you'll have the news about these approvals or rejections as soon as possible. Other than that, the typical financial news that are found in the US are also quick in determining these news because information are being spread to them whenever it's needed a media coverage and press conference.

comments.author: slapper
comments.body: Your excitement for the bitcoin spot ETF is apparent. The joyful anticipation of the bull run and a crypto future better than ever! It's quite touching. The SEC makes announcements on their website, but that's not a time-optimized approach. Even if you're hooked to your computer hammering "refresh," a delay is inevitable, annoying, and unavoidable. Unfortunately, media outlets often get such information first. Their regulatory contacts allow them to break news first. Not fair, but that's life, right? Subscribe to the SEC's RSS feeds or follow them on Twitter. They may update faster than their webpage.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 13, 2023, 07:46:17 AMHow can I get the news directly from the SEC in a matter of a second? Is it through their website or which news?You are looking for someone insider to provide you news. I am sure no one here can help you. But if you are willing to take it slowly, you can visit the press release page of SEC website and probably subscribe to their email notification. https://www.sec.gov/page/newsThis might help you to get the news delivered to you as soon as the news is ready for the market. Don't expect anything faster than that.

I will suggest you forget about SEC and adopt the dollar-cost averaging investment techniques.

Is it through their website or which news?To find out classified information before others, you must have a source within the SEC, which means you have to get a job at that agency or you have to find a way to become friends with Uncle Gensler Now seriously, I take it you think that the possible approval of spot BTC ETF might cause bull run, but somehow it doesn't seem to me that it's wise to wait for that very moment when you can practice the DCA method today and prepare for that moment. When (if) this happens, you should count on many people to want to react like you, and that means that most CEX could go offline under pressure from clients, and fees could go skyrocketing.However, it should be taken into account that after this news the market will react positively, but also that it will not be long-lived because who can say with certainty that large investors will really invest billions in such a fund? Examples from some other countries where such an ETF exists have shown that large investors are not too enthusiastic about it, although we can hardly compare such a market in Canada with that in the US.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: You opened up a new level of fear about the ETF, we've already had a few times where the ETF was rejected and it didn't affect the priceQuote from: https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/etf/bitcoin-etf-proposals-the-sec-s-long-history-of-rejections-1030261105July 2013: The first ever attempt at a Bitcoin ETF came from Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, who proposed the Winklevoss Bitcoin Trust. The SEC officially rejected the proposal in March 2017.July 2017: Grayscale officially filed an application for its Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (OTCQX:GBTC) in July 2017. Three months later, Grayscale withdrew its application to the SEC and chose to list its fund on the OTC market.January 2019: Bitwise proposed the Bitwise Bitcoin ETF Trust in January 2019. The SEC rejected its proposal about nine months later.June 2020: WisdomTree submitted an application for a commodity fund that would invest up to 5% of its assets in Bitcoin futures. WisdomTree followed up by proposing a separate Bitcoin ETF just this month.December 2020: SEC Chair Jay Clayton stepped down from his position. In January 2021, President Joe Biden nominated former chairman of the Commodity Future Trading Commission Gary Gensler as Clayton’s replacement.Quote the link below and you will find that more than 10 ETFs have already been rejected.https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/etf/bitcoin-etf-proposals-the-sec-s-long-history-of-rejections-1030261105Even when the first US BITCOIN ETF is officially announced, the moment will rise by 10% to 20%, and this will be followed by a rise, but it is in the long term. Such news will spread quickly, and the trading bots will be quick to take advantage of the easy profits. your only chance is to know the matter before it happens, and it is information that is difficult for the average user to obtain without having relationships. guessing and assuming that Bitcoin will rise during the next two years is the best solution.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: I think if you had a Bloomberg terminal then you would be one of the first to get the news. However last I checked it costs like 5 figures for the year. It’s not exactly for retail people.You can follow certain individuals or bots on twitter and it would be the second quickest way of getting the news. But you would need certain filters because they report on everything. The slowest is obviously coindesk and coin telegraph which always releases news reports hours later.

I agree with what has been mentioned above, just buy Bitcoin now and DCA if the price moves against your liking.
